thread.title: Gigi Gorgeous Is a Revlon Ambassador Now and We're So Excited For Her
thread.title_full: Gigi Gorgeous Is a Revlon Ambassador Now and We're So Excited For Her

title: Gigi Gorgeous Is a Revlon Ambassador Now and We're So Excited For Her
text: February 9, 2017 D Dipasupil/Getty Images The beauty world has gotten all the more inclusive lately, which is why we were so excited to learn that Gigi Gorgeous is a Revlon ambassador now, the first transgender spokesperson for the brand. The YouTuber joins fellow makeup vlogger Kandee Johnson , celebrity makeup artist Etienne Ortega, and Disney star Sabrina Carpenter, reports WWD . It makes total sense that Revlon would choose these influencers to help the company reach even more beauty-obsessed people. Gorgeous boasts 2.2 million Instagram followers, Johnson has 1.5 million, Ortega has 460k, and Carpenter has 10.8 million followers. That's a massive reach. And, as WWD points out, they each reach a bit of a different audience within the beauty community. Many follow Gorgeous for her refreshing thoughts on gender identity, as well as a real-life approach to beauty with hacks and tricks to look your best. She's excited to join the Revlon team, because she used to brand as a teenager—which is when she started her YouTube channel. You May Also Like Celebrity Kylie Jenner Is Accused of Repackaging Old Lip Kit Shades As New Colors "It’s always been a staple at the drugstore, and when I started buying makeup, I always went to Revlon because I knew they had my back when it came to beauty," she told WWD . "I didn’t have a huge collection of my own—I would literally steal makeup from my mother." As for Carpenter, she gives Revlon that Gen Z edge, and we all know that generation is the future. For the 17-year-old actor/singer, she appreciates how affordable Revlon is. "At my age, you don’t want to spend $100 to have nice eyelashes," she told WWD . Loading
